text: I am making a big arugula salad for
Thanksgiving every year everybody at the
New York Times food section sits down
and figures out what's our Thanksgiving
plan this year what are we gonna do and
every year there's this lively debate
let's call it that
between the editor Sam Sifton and myself
he says no salad on the table and I say
what are you kidding of course there has
to be salad on the table with all that
rich brown food you really need
something bright and green to lighten
things up in my house we eat a lot of
salad especially Dalia my daughter she's
just she's all about the salad I need
the juice of an entire lemon in this
dressing and I'm gonna show you my lemon
trick okay so you see how I've quartered
it take out the seeds and I can just
squeeze it directly into the blender you
get a lot of juice that way I have the
garlic the salt and the lemon juice in
the blender and I'm gonna let that sit
for five minutes what that does is it
dissolves the salt so you get better
distribution and also it mellows out the
garlic a little bit so it's not quite as
sharp guy is a ten year old girl who
likes nothing better than a giant bowl
of salad but she thinks she doesn't like
anchovy however I'm going to sneak just
a couple of them in this dressing
they're gonna be mashed up she's not
even gonna know they're there
I love anchovy on a turkey I love it in
the salad Melissa really brought me into
the the world of the anchovy
so the reason I'm tossing with my hands
is it's much gentler on the lettuce and
that way you really get the dressing
well distributed without bruising it the
thing about salad is no matter how big
it is it always gets eaten at least in
our house
[Music]
you
